items.message:
High tides, strong winds and large waves today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible around the high tide between 5:30 - 8:30pm on Sunday 07/09/2025.

Areas most at risk are coastal roads and footpaths and frontages around South Pier and the Lifeboat Station in Bridlington.

We are closely monitoring the situation and do not expect the situation to escalate. Be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.
.
This message will be updated by 8:00am on 08/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: South Cornwall Coast, Tidal Fal Estuary

items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tide on Sunday evening. High water at Falmouth is at 6:00pm, times of high water will vary along the coast. 

High water levels are forecast to cause flooding between 5.00pm and 7:00pm. 

Locations particularly at risk include low lying areas in Falmouth, Penryn, Flushing, Mylor Bridge and the A39 at Perranarworthal. 

Waterside locations and roads along the estuary may be flooded. Do not walk or drive through flood water.   

Coastal conditions should ease for Monday morning's high tide, however, conditions are forecast to worsen from Tuesday evening, bringing a further risk of flooding. Flood alerts and warnings will be issued if required. 

We are monitoring the situation and will update this information by midday Monday, or if the situation changes. The tidal gates at Flushing have been closed. 

Detailed tidal information; The forecast high tide at Falmouth is 2.55 mAOD. Expect tide levels to be around 0.2m above tide table level. Strong force 5 southwesterly winds and offshore waves of up to 2m are forecast over the high tide.

This Flood Alert has been issued due to the high tide forecast in the early hours of tomorrow morning, 08/09/2025.  
Flooding is possible at low lying lands and roads from 12:30 AM on 08/09/2025 at the following locations:  
Fiddlers Ferry, peaking around 1:00 AM  
Eastford Road, peaking around 1:15 AM  
Arpley Bridge, peaking around 1:30 AM  
It is possible that river levels may affect Arpley Road under the railway bridge. 
We are expecting higher than normal tides over the next 5 days and as a result we may issue further flood alerts and flood warnings.  
We currently do not anticipate the Flood Alert level to be met during the high tide tomorrow afternoon 08/09/2025. 
Our incident rooms are open and we are closely monitoring the situation.  
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.  
This message will be updated by 09:00 AM on 08/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

Tonight’s high tide is the start of a period of high spring tides. Flooding of roads and low-lying land is possible from 9:00 PM on Sunday 7 September 2025 through to 1:00 AM on Monday 8 September 2025, with the high tide expected to peak at around 11:00 PM on Sunday night. Property flooding is not expected.
Areas most at risk are within the Sandside area of North Morecambe Bay.

Please avoid driving through flood water and do not put yourself or others at risk.

The lunchtime tide tomorrow, Monday 8 September, is forecast to peak below flood alert criteria. Tomorrow night’s tide, Monday 8 into Tuesday 9 September, will peak above the flood alert level. This period of spring tides will peak between Tuesday 9 September and Thursday 11 September.

We will update this message by 10:00 AM on Monday 8 September 2025, or sooner if the situation changes.

items.description: Wyre estuary from Fleetwood and Knott End to Little Eccleston
items.message:
High tides tonight may lead to flooding of low lying land and roads.
Flooding is possible around the high tide from 12:00 midnight on 08/09/2025.
Areas most at risk include Tiger's Tail, Wyre Dock, Burrow's Marsh, Burn Naze, Thornton, Trunnah, Stanah, Poulton-le-Fylde, Skippool, Hambleton, Cold Row, Little Singleton, Little Eccleston and Crow Woods.
The tide at 12:30 lunchtime on Monday 08/09/2025 is not forecast to reach flood alert level, however the tide at midnight on Monday night will. High tides will be experienced for much of the coming week. 
We are closely monitoring the situation.
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.
Don't put yourself or others at risk.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 08/09/2025, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Sandyford Brook, Ridings Brook, Saredon Brook
